meanings.definition: Strict adherence to established forms, rules, or principles.
meanings.sent1: In his art, he followed a strict formalism, always sticking to the traditional rules.
meanings.sent2: The formalism of the ceremony required everyone to wear formal attire.
meanings.sent3: The formalism of the school's dress code even specified the color of socks students could wear.
meanings.sent4: Her writing displayed a formalism that echoed the rigidity of a mathematical equation.
meanings.sent5: The formalism of the recipe left no room for improvisation, resulting in a perfect dish every time.

meanings.definition: The practice or doctrine of strict adherence to prescribed forms.
meanings.sent1: The ballet company's formalism demanded precise movements from every dancer.
meanings.sent2: His formalism in following the company's guidelines earned him the respect of his peers.
meanings.sent3: The formalism of the office policy required all employees to sign in and out every day.
meanings.sent4: The formalism of the legal system ensured that all procedures were followed to the letter.
meanings.sent5: The formalism of the traditional tea ceremony was a sight to behold, with every movement carefully choreographed.
